Qustion: She did not draw to please her teacher. Seeing her first dot framed made her realize that she can make better dots.

She set her own goals and timelines. She did not rush to make the best dot. She took her time slowly to experiment making lots of little dots in many colours. She was perseverant; she did it thoroughly and regularly despite challenges.
Her teacher did not put pressure on her to perform. She let her feel free to paint as she wants. This let her enjoy the process!
Vashti saw that the dot is bigger than herself, and found meaning in making it. The act of making a dot made her understand herself in the larger context of the universe.
She learned about herself, art, and her teacher while paintings the dots. She did not compare herself to others; instead she focused on making the dot better each time she made a new one.
She advised the boy to sign exactly the way her teacher asked her to sign her artwork. She paid it forward and felt growth.
